wikipedia_page.main: Dorothy Edwards (18 August 1902 – 5 January 1934), was a Welsh novelist of the early 20th century who wrote in English. She became associated with David Garnett and other members of the Bloomsbury Group, but she stated in a note before her suicide that she had "accepted kindness and friendship and even love without gratitude, and given nothing in return."

response: *Dorothy Edwards (Welsh novelist) wrote the 1927 short story collection 'Rhapsody' and the 1928 novel 'Winter Sonata'. Edwards was born in Ogmore Vale in 1903 and died by suicide in 1934. Her parents both taught in Tynewydd school

The majority of titles are novels, autobiographies and short story anthologies in English; Honno also publishes some poetry, books for children and teenagers, and books in Welsh.Honno: Welcome to Honno! (accessed 18 February 2009) The press's 450 authors include Lindsay Ashford, Anne Beale, Brenda Chamberlain, Gillian Clarke, Carol Ann Courtney, Amy Dillwyn, Dorothy Edwards, Menna Gallie, Mererid Hopwood, Siân James, Anne Lewis, Eiluned Lewis, Gwyneth Lewis, Catherine Merriman, Lynette Roberts, Kitty Sewell and Hilda Vaughan.Honno: Authors, Editors and Contributors (accessed 18 February 2009) The Honno's Classics series republishes books which have been out of print for many years.
* Dorothy Edwards (children's writer) (1914–1982), English children's writer
